Help & How Review Works

Home

This page explains the review flow and what each review button does. Use this to understand how your choices affect scheduling.

App flow

Start by choosing a Card Set. From the set's Dashboard, start a Review session. During Review you'll rate cards using the five buttons. When you're done, the Success screen summarizes progress.

Front Side

When you see the question and need to decide how to proceed:

üëÄ Show me
Reveal the back of the card or a hint when you're not sure or want to check your answer. After viewing, you'll rate how well you remembered it (Easy/Good/Again) ‚Äî that choice determines the card's future scheduling.
üí™ Confident
Use this when you can recall the answer instantly and accurately. The scheduler treats this as a strong success and will increase spacing significantly before the next review. This is the fastest way to advance through well-known cards.

Back Side

After seeing the answer, rate how well you remembered based on your performance:

üîÅ Again
You didn't remember it well or want more practice. Re-queue the card in the current session so you can try it again. This doesn't advance the spaced repetition interval but helps with immediate reinforcement.
üôÇ Good
You remembered it but with some effort or after thinking about it. The scheduler will moderately increase the interval for this card, so it will be shown less often than immediately, but not as much as <strong>Easy</strong>.
‚ú® Easy
You recalled it with little effort and felt confident. The scheduler will significantly lengthen the interval before this specific card's next review ‚Äî meaning this card will be shown much less frequently.

How ratings affect scheduling

We use a spaced-repetition scheduler (SM-2 inspired). Here's how each choice affects when you'll see the card again:

  • Front Side:
    • Confident signals near mastery and increases spacing significantly for that card.
    • Show me reveals the answer, then you rate with back-side buttons.
  • Back Side:
    • Again keeps the card in the current session for immediate repetition.
    • Good and Easy increase the review interval for that specific card ‚Äî meaning it will be scheduled further into the future and shown less frequently.
    • Easy increases the interval much more than Good.

Examples & Tips

Practical Examples:

  1. Front Side: See "Áà±" (Chinese character) ‚Üí If you instantly know it means "love", press <strong>Confident</strong>. If unsure, press <strong>Show me</strong> to reveal the answer.
  2. Back Side: After seeing the answer, if you got it right easily, press <strong>Easy</strong>. If you struggled but remembered, press <strong>Good</strong>. If you want more practice, press <strong>Again</strong>.
  3. If you press <strong>Again</strong> multiple times on a card, you'll see that same card several times in this session until you choose a higher rating.
  4. When you press <strong>Easy</strong>, that card will usually be scheduled much later (for example, next week instead of tomorrow). The exact timing depends on the card's history and algorithm.
